questions.text: Who was Cat Grant's new assistant?
questions.explanation:
Eve Teschmacher.

	Eve Teschmacher was a character from the first two live-action "Superman" movies. The name, and not much else, was taken for the character here. Instead of being Lex Luthor's mistress, she served as Cat and later James Olsen's assistant in "Supergirl".

questions.text: What was wrong with Cat's salad?
options: It got knocked to the ground
questions.explanation:
It had too much dressing.

	Cat, played by Calista Flockhart, was known to complain about everything. When upset over her salad, she said that the lettuce was "drowning in ranch" and that it was "floating like Kate Winslet" in the movie "Titanic".

questions.text: When picking a new job, what did Kara pick first?
questions.explanation:
Marketing.

	At first Kara decided she wanted to go into the "Catco Magazine" marketing department.  She had used an app to help her pick the job, and wasn't as good a fit as she had thought she would be. Cat Grant told her to go pick a new job again, and to let her know within 48 hours.

questions.text: Which former U.S. President did Cat make fun of?
questions.explanation:
George Bush.

	Cat Grant made fun of George W. Bush a couple times. Her biggest complaint about him was that he went to Yale. She was making fun of her assistant at the same time, as they went to the same college.

questions.text: Were Superman and Supergirl shown together on screen?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Kara was having her first date with James Olsen as the space shuttle launch was going on. Superman went out to help with a disaster on that, when the right engine blew up. Supergirl also went to assist. It was the first time in the series they had both appeared on screen together.

Clark Kent.

	Clark Kent, played by Tyler Hoechlin, made his debut in the series. He was referenced, both as Clark and as Superman in the first season. He appeared in one season one episode, but only shown were his boots and cape in a non-speaking role. This was the first time they appeared together on screen.  Supergirl told a group of kids that she used to change his diapers after they helped to save the space shuttle together.

Lex's sister.

	Lana was the opposite of Lex Luthor. Where he was a criminal, she was a philanthropist. She took over his company after he went to prison, and became friends with Kara Danvers.

questions.text: What was Lex Corp renamed to?
questions.explanation:
L Corp.

	Lana wanted a fresh start after taking over the company. She wanted to push that the company was under different leadership, and that it was going in a new direction. She took Lex's name off the buildings and left just her own first initial.

J'onn.

	The Martian Manhunter, or J'onn J'onzz, officially named Kryptonite in the "Supergirl" series. He and Superman didn't get along during this episode, which was finally explained near the end of the episode. During the explanation, he mentioned that he had named the mineral known as Kryptonite.

questions.text: What job did Kara pick at the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Reporter.

	Kara told Cat that being a reporter would push her out of her comfort zone. Cat told her that she knew all along that Kara would pick being a reporter, and that she would be able to "use the hero inside" of her to help do the job.
